1499886154157473794.text:
Nine days.
One million refugees.
Thousands injured or killed.
Untold lives disrupted.

The human costs of Putin’s war are staggering.

1499825458032136195.text:

And weaponized the DOJ against Trump’s enemies.

That’s awful material for a book. Or a legacy.

1499761709849972738.text:
Breonna Taylor should be alive today.

Her death was a needless tragedy.

Made worse by the absence of accountability. 

My prayers are with her family.

1499435964942405633.text:
Young people work so hard to pursue education.

Yet too often, food insecurity forces them to choose between staying in school and feeding themselves or their families.

That's why @RepBarragan and I introduced the Food for Thought Act.

We have the power to end student hunger.

1499165154168164355.text:
We’re witnessing a GOP assault on LGBTQ+ kids.

In Arkansas, they've banned health care for trans kids.
In Florida, they've demonized LGBTQ+ kids in the classroom.

And now in Texas, they're investigating parents of trans kids as “abusers.”

It’s sick. And plain wrong.

1499127411383881728.text:
We've still got a long way to go, and inflation is taking a toll, but our economy has made great progress under President Biden.

Unemployment is down.
Job creation is up.
The economy is booming.

As we put the worst of the pandemic behind us, America is bouncing back.

1499067020121419778.text:
America was built by workers and working families.

The hundreds of millions of people who make this country run.

President Biden knows that.

And last night he demonstrated his commitment to rebuilding our economy from the bottom up and middle out.

1499033439340740608.text:
Last night, President Biden laid out his plan to end gun violence.

A key part of it? Cracking down on reckless gun dealers and manufacturers by repealing their liability shield.

My Equal Access to Justice for Victims of Gun Violence Act does just that.

Count me in, @POTUS.

1498878581816102918.text:
Tonight, against the backdrop of Putin's invasion of Ukraine, President Biden sent an unequivocal message:

America stands with Ukraine – and with democracies around the world.

We will not bend nor break in the face of an authoritarian bully.

There is simply too much at stake.

1498432837187428354.text:
Like all of you, I am in awe of the courage of the Ukrainian people, fighting to protect their homeland.

Their courage underscores the depths of Putin's cowardice.

1498387035475824644.text:
A new report found climate change is unfolding so rapidly that it may soon become impossible for us to adapt.

This is a five-alarm fire.

We need all hands on deck, taking unprecedented action to fight back.

An Apollo-like project to save us. A Green New Deal.

1498334250772357125.text:

I will keep the Feinstein family – and all who loved Richard – in my prayers.

May his memory be a blessing.

1497374020832010248.text:
Putin alone is responsible for the death and destruction this war will bring.
 
As we work to hold him accountable, we must support those who will be displaced, injured, orphaned, or worse by this needless bloodshed.
 
My thoughts continue to be with the Ukrainian people.

1497374018239975428.text:
Finally, and just as critically, I want to talk about humanitarian aid for the millions of civilians now in harm's way.
 
We must allocate funds to support the resettlement of refugees and provide other forms of assistance to the victims of Putin's war.

1497374017250107395.text:
These were the right call and will drive up the cost of this war for Putin.

I also believe we should continue to look for additional means to respond, including terminating Russia’s ability to use SWIFT.

We should also continue providing defensive military support to Ukraine.

1497374015958171649.text:
Before the war, the admin crafted a massive sanctions package to respond to an invasion.

Those sanctions have been issued, and will cause significant pain to the Russian economy. They cut off banks from the global finance system, target oligarchs, and block high-tech exports.

1497374015001964548.text:
Over the next days, I will be closely watching Kyiv.

From Putin's public statements, I believe he intends to remove Ukraine's leadership to install pro-Russian puppets.

Russian forces are already encircling Kyiv and other major cities. Civilian casualties could be very high.

1497374013831753729.text:
Ukraine’s President Zelenskyy has demonstrated incredible bravery, leading his nation under assault.

The Ukrainian military and ordinary citizens are doing the same and our prayers - and unrelenting support - are with them as they defend their nation against Russian invaders.

1497374012745437187.text:
First, while we are still in the early days, I believe Putin likely underestimated the Ukrainian will to fight.

Russia has an advantage in firepower and numbers, but the Ukrainians are fighting for their freedom and on their own soil. 

They will not give up without a struggle.

1497374011050835968.text:
🧵: For many weeks, U.S. Intelligence agencies have warned of the potential for a major Russian invasion of Ukraine.
 
Despite serious efforts at diplomacy, that warning has proven all too accurate.

I want to take a moment to share some thoughts on where we go from here.

1497226751247720451.text:

1497010306211590145.text:

1496888904049471488.text:

And, most critically, an attack on democracy itself.

A right under attack - a right we must protect by abolishing the filibuster.

The filibuster must die so that democracy can live.
